H0.text: What, the first of its kind in Britain, was established by John Tate in Stevenage, Hertfordshire in 1489. Printing Press

H1.text: What, the first of its kind in Britain, was established by John Tate in Stevenage, Hertfordshire in 1489. Textile Mill

H2.text: What, the first of its kind in Britain, was established by John Tate in Stevenage, Hertfordshire in 1489. Fulling Mill

H3.text: What, the first of its kind in Britain, was established by John Tate in Stevenage, Hertfordshire in 1489. Papermill

A4.text: Paper was produced there in the 1490s, and possibly earlier.

A5.text: Sele Mill was just outside Hertford, but now it is within the town's suburbs.

A6.text: The first reference to a paper mill in England was in a book printed by Wynken de Worde c.â€¯1495; the mill, near Hertford, belonged to John Tate.

A7.text: the mill, near Hertford, belonged to John Tate

A8.text: The first mechanized paper machine was installed at Frogmore Paper Mill, Apsley, Hertfordshire in 1803, followed by another in 1804.
